SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.text

Class FontDef

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.text.FontDef
public final class FontDef extends Object
A mutable class holding font attributes to help create immutable font instances.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FontDef()
    Default constructor that creates a {FontDe} instance without any properties set.

      public static FontDef parseFontspec(String fontspec)
      Parse fontspec.
      Parameters:
      fontspec - the fontspec
      Returns:
      FontDef instance matching fontspec
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ont definition could not be parsed
      NumberFormatException - if a numeric value could not be parsed

    • parseCssFontDef

      public static FontDef parseCssFontDef(String fontdef)
      Parse fontspec.
      Parameters:
      fontdef - the CSS font definition
      Returns:
      FontDef instance matching fontspec

    • fontspec

      public String fontspec()
      Get fontspec for this FontDef instance.

      The fontspec returned by this method will always return a fontspec containing all attributes. An asterisk ('*') is used for attributes whose values are not defined in the FontDef instance so that it is possible to reparse a fontspec into a FontDef that will be equal to the original one.

      Returns:
      String representation of this instance

    • getBold

      public @Nullable Boolean getBold()
      Retrieves the bold property of the FontDef instance.
      Returns:
      a Boolean indicating whether the bold attribute is set. It returns true if bold is enabled, false if disabled, or null if the bold attribute is not defined.

    • setBold

      public void setBold(@Nullable Boolean bold)
      Sets the bold property of the font definition.
      Parameters:
      bold - the value to set for the bold property. It can be true, false, or null to represent bold, non-bold, or unspecified respectively.

    • getColor

      public @Nullable Color getColor()
      Retrieves the color attribute associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      the color attribute, or null if no color is defined

    • setColor

      public void setColor(@Nullable Color color)
      Sets the color attribute of the FontDef instance.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to set, which can be null

    • getFamilies

      public @Nullable List<String> getFamilies()
      Retrieves the font family value of this instance.
      Returns:
      the font family as a string, or null if no family is defined

    • getFamily

      public @Nullable String getFamily()
      Retrieves the font family value of this instance.
      Returns:
      the font family as a string, or null if no family is defined

    • setFamilies

      public void setFamilies(@Nullable SequencedCollection<String> families)
      Sets the font family names for the FontDef instance.
      Parameters:
      families - the font family names to set. Can be null if no font family is specified.

    • getItalic

      Returns:
      a Boolean indicating whether the italic property is set, or null if the italic property is undefined.

    • setItalic

      public void setItalic(@Nullable Boolean italic)
      Sets the italic property of the font definition.
      Parameters:
      italic - the value to set for the italic property. It can be null to indicate that the property is undefined.

    • getSize

      public @Nullable Float getSize()
      Retrieves the size attribute of this FontDef instance.
      Returns:
      the size of the font as a Float, or null if the size is not set

    • setSize

      public void setSize(@Nullable Float size)
      Sets the size of the font.
      Parameters:
      size - the font size in points. Can be null if the size is not defined.

    • getStrikeThrough

      public @Nullable Boolean getStrikeThrough()
      Retrieves the value of the strike-through property of the font definition.
      Returns:
      the strike-through state, or null if it is not defined

    • setStrikeThrough

      public void setStrikeThrough(@Nullable Boolean strikeThrough)
      Sets the strike-through property for the font.
      Parameters:
      strikeThrough - a Boolean value indicating whether the font should have a strike-through effect. If null, the strike-through property will not be explicitly set.

    • getUnderline

      public @Nullable Boolean getUnderline()
      Retrieves the current value of the underline property for this FontDef instance.
      Returns:
      the underline property, which may be true, false, or null if not explicitly set

    • setUnderline

      public void setUnderline(@Nullable Boolean underline)
      Sets the underline attribute for the font.
      Parameters:
      underline - the underline attribute to set, or null to unset it
